instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840-A trackpad not working
threads.message:
So to cut a long story short one of my colleagues went to change the keyboard on an A1708 macbook, ripped the touchpad cable in the process. We have replaced the touchpad cable but the touchpad is still not functioning. So we got another touchpad cable - same. We have then replaced the touchpad itself and yet same behaviour - the touchpad wont move but will occasionally click. Keyboard does work however - it didnt work with the original ripped trackpad cable. 

F4800 is fine, i'm really not sure where to go with this - i've had two trackpad cables from the same supplier neither are working with either the old trackpad or a new one. I don't have any known good other machine to test it on  but other than trying with yet more trackpads and trackpad cables from other suppliers i'm not sure if theres anything on the board which may have burned with the ripped cable?

threads.title: 820-00840-A trackpad not working
threads.message:
L4800 is good too?
Check all voltages for J4801.
If all good, change U4830.

threads.title: 820-00840-A trackpad not working
threads.message: Right on - L4800 was burned thanks for pointing me in that direction! Strange that it was still clicking with this burned though!
